top_categories.workout_context: Big Sky Gravel's Montana mountains, Local event forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 70 miles.
71ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
At Big Sky Gravel, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Big Sky Gravel's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before August.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Big Sky Gravel. Train it until it feels boring.
5,000ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.
5,000ft of climbing on grades that change every minute. You need to switch from seated to standing without losing rhythm.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Big Sky Gravel, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
70 miles on Montana mountain gravel burns energy faster than the distance suggests. Train the fade resistance now.
Base fitness for Big Sky Gravel. Without this, the hard workouts break you down instead of building you up.
Low-cadence force work for 5,000ft of climbing. The slow, grinding ascents where you can't spin—you push.
Double-threshold training builds sustained power with less fatigue. More FTP per hour of training.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Big Sky Gravel’s 70 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at Big Sky Gravel. Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Big Sky Gravel requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on montana mountain gravel to build confidence. Expect: montana mountains, local event, mountain west gravel.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, TT Threshold, and Over Under to prepare you for 70 miles of montana mountain gravel in Red Lodge, Montana.
